value.name: host
value.description: IP or hostname to your DeepStack server.

value.name: port
value.description: Port to your DeepStack server.

value.name: api_key
value.description: API key to your DeepStack server, if you have one set.

value.name: timeout
value.description: Timeout for requests to your DeepStack server.

value.name: fps
value.description:
The FPS at which the object detector runs.
Higher values will result in more scanning, which uses more resources.

value.name: scan_on_motion_only
value.description: When set to true and a motion_detector is configured, the object detector will only scan while motion is detected.

values.name: label
values.description: The label to track.

values.name: confidence
values.description: Lowest confidence allowed for detected objects. The lower the value, the more sensitive the detector will be, and the risk of false positives will increase.

values.name: height_min
values.description: Minimum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: height_max
values.description: Maximum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: width_min
values.description: Minimum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: width_max
values.description: Maximum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: trigger_recorder
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will start the recorder.

values.name: require_motion
values.description: If set to true, the recorder will stop as soon as motion is no longer detected, even if the object still is. This is useful to avoid never ending recordings of stationary objects, such as a car on a driveway

value.name: labels
value.description: A list of labels (objects) to track.

value.name: max_frame_age
value.description: Drop frames that are older than the given number. Specified in seconds.

value.name: log_all_objects
value.description: When set to true and loglevel is DEBUG, all found objects will be logged, including the ones not tracked by labels.

values.name: x
values.description: X-coordinate (horizontal axis).

values.name: y
values.description: Y-coordinate (vertical axis).

values.name: coordinates
values.description: List of X and Y coordinates to form a polygon

value.name: mask
value.description: A mask is used to exclude certain areas in the image from object detection.

values.name: name
values.description: Name of the zone. Has to be unique per camera.

values.name: x
values.description: X-coordinate (horizontal axis).

values.name: y
values.description: Y-coordinate (vertical axis).

values.name: coordinates
values.description: List of X and Y coordinates to form a polygon

values.name: label
values.description: The label to track.

values.name: confidence
values.description: Lowest confidence allowed for detected objects. The lower the value, the more sensitive the detector will be, and the risk of false positives will increase.

values.name: height_min
values.description: Minimum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: height_max
values.description: Maximum height allowed for detected objects, relative to stream height.

values.name: width_min
values.description: Minimum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: width_max
values.description: Maximum width allowed for detected objects, relative to stream width.

values.name: trigger_recorder
values.description: If set to true, objects matching this filter will start the recorder.

values.name: require_motion
values.description: If set to true, the recorder will stop as soon as motion is no longer detected, even if the object still is. This is useful to avoid never ending recordings of stationary objects, such as a car on a driveway

values.name: labels
values.description: A list of labels (objects) to track.

value.name: zones
value.description: Zones are used to define areas in the cameras field of view where you want to look for certain objects (labels).
Camera identifier. Valid characters are lowercase a-z, numbers and underscores.

value.name: cameras
value.description: Camera-specific configuration. All subordinate keys corresponds to the camera_identifier of a configured camera.

value.name: image_width
value.description: Frames will be resized to this width before inference to save computing power.

value.name: image_height
value.description: Frames will be resized to this height before inference to save computing power.

value.name: custom_model
value.description: Name of a custom DeepStack model. More information here.

value.name: object_detector
value.description: Object detector domain config.

value.name: labels
value.description: A list of labels that when detected will be sent to the post processor. Applies only to this specific camera.
Camera identifier. Valid characters are lowercase a-z, numbers and underscores.

value.name: cameras
value.description: Camera-specific configuration. All subordinate keys corresponds to the camera_identifier of a configured camera.

value.name: labels
value.description: A list of labels that when detected will be sent to the post processor. Applies to all cameras defined under cameras.

value.name: face_recognition_path
value.description: Path to folder which contains subdirectories with images for each face to track.

value.name: save_unknown_faces
value.description: If true, any unrecognized face will be saved to the folder specified in unknown_faces_path. You can then move this image to the folder of the correct person to improve accuracy.

value.name: unknown_faces_path
value.description: Path to folder where unknown faces will be stored.

value.name: expire_after
value.description: Time in seconds before a detected face is no longer considered detected.

value.name: detect_remote_faces
value.description: If true, faces trained using other methods will be detected.

value.name: train
value.description: Train DeepStack to recognize faces on Viseron start. Disable this when you have a good model trained.

value.name: min_confidence
value.description: Minimum confidence for a face to be considered a match.

value.name: face_recognition
value.description: Face recognition domain config.
